meanings.sent1: I need to restamp the letter with the correct date.
meanings.sent2: She forgot to restamp the envelope before sending it out.
meanings.sent3: The teacher had to restamp the student's homework because the ink was too light.
meanings.sent4: After the rain washed away the first stamp, she had to restamp the address on the package.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith had to restamp the metal with the family crest.

meanings.definition: A stamp that has been stamped again.
meanings.sent1: The collector was excited to add the rare restamp to his collection.
meanings.sent2: The post office mistakenly used a restamp on the letter.
meanings.sent3: The restamp on the package made it look like it had traveled the world twice.
meanings.sent4: The restamp on the passport raised suspicions at the border.
meanings.sent5: The restamp on the coin decreased its value to collectors.
